Name: Latticed Stool of Sennedjem
Description: The latticed stool belonged to the artisan Sennedjem. This type of stool is considered to be among the most commonly used of his time. It is made of thin struts of wood with angled braces supporting the seat. Four rounded, animal-shaped legs support the chair. The shortness of this stool suggests that it might have been used as a footrest placed under a high chair.
